Name: Trinidad Sour
Ingredients:
45 ml Angostura Bitters
30 ml Orgeat Syrup
22.5 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
15 ml Rye Whisky
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Barracuda
Ingredients:
45 ml Gold Rum
15 ml Galliano
60 ml Fresh Pineapple Juice
1 dash Fresh Lime Juice
Top up with Prosecco
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the Prosecco, shake well with ice, strain into chilled highball glass filled with ice and top up with Prosecco.
Garnish: Pineapple and Cherry, optional mint sprig for additional aroma.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Bloody Mary
Ingredients:
45 ml Vodka
90 ml Tomato Juice
15 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
2 dashes Worcestershire Sauce
Tabasco, Celery Salt, Pepper (Up to taste)
Making:
Stir gently all the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, pour into rocks glass.
Note:
If requested served with ice, pour into highball glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Caipirinha
Ingredients:
60 ml Cachaça
1 Lime cut into small wedges
4 Teaspoons White Cane Sugar
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Cosmopolitan
Ingredients:
40 ml Vodka Citron
15 ml Cointreau
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
30 ml Cranberry Juice
Making: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Espresso Martini
Ingredients:
50 ml Vodka
30 ml Kahlúa
10 ml Sugar Syrup
1 strong Espresso
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Gin Fizz
Ingredients:
45 ml Gin
30 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
10 ml Simple Syrup
Splash of Soda Water
Making: Shake all ingredients with ice except soda water. Pour into thin tall Tumbler glass , top with a splash soda water.
Garnish: Garnish with a lemon slice, optional lemon zest.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Horse’s Neck
Ingredients:
40 ml Cognac
120 ml Ginger Ale
Dash of Angostura Bitters (optional)
Making:
Pour Cognac and ginger ale directly into a highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently.
If preferred, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.
Garnish: Garnish with a rind of one lemon spiral.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Last word
Ingredients:

22.5 ml Green Chartreuse

22.5 ml Fresh Lime Juice
Making: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Margarita
Ingredients:
50 ml Tequila 100% Agave
20 ml Triple Sec
15 ml Freshly Squeezed Lime Juice
Making:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

Name: Mojito
Ingredients:
45 ml White Cuban Ron
20 ml  Fresh Lime Juice
6 pcs Mint Sprigs
2 tsp White Cane Sugar
Soda Water
Making: Mix mint springs with sugar and lime juice. Add splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Light stir to involve all ingredients.
Garnish: Garnish with sprigs of mint and slice of lime.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: New York Sour
Ingredients:
60 ml Rye Whiskey or Bourbon
22.5 ml Simple syrup
30 ml Fresh lemon juice
Few Drops of Egg White
15 ml Red wine (Shiraz or Malbech)
Making: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice. Float the wine on top.
Garnish: Garnish with lemon or orange zest with cherry.

Name: Paradise

Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Porto Flip

Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Making: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

50 ml Vodka Vanilla

Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

Ingredients:

Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Ingredients:
52.5 ml Dry Gin
2 teaspoons Honey Syrup

Making: Stir honey with lemon and orange juices until it dissolves, add gin and shake with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Optionally garnish with a lemon or orange zest.

Name: Boulevardier
Ingredients:
45 ml Bourbon or Rye Whiskey

Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Garnish with orange zest, optionally a lemon zest.

Name: Casino
Ingredients:
40 ml Old Tom Gin

Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktails shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled rocks glass with ice.

Name: Cuba Libre

50 ml White Rum

Making: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

Name: Fernandito
Ingredients:
50 ml Fernet Branca
Fill up with Cola
Making: Pour the Fernet Branca into a double old fashioned glass with ice, fill the glass up with Cola. Gently stir.

Name: Golden Dream

20 ml Galliano
20 ml Triple Sec
20 ml Fresh Orange Juice
10 ml Fresh Cream
Making: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Illegal
Ingredients:
30 ml Espadin Mezcal
15 ml Jamaica Overproof White Rum
15 ml Falernum
1 Bar Spoon Maraschino Luxardo
22.5 ml Fresh Lime Juice
15 ml Simple Syrup
Few Drops of Egg White (Optional)
Making: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, or “on the rocks” in a traditional clay or terracotta mug.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Lemon drop Martini
Ingredients: 30 ml Vodka Citron 20 ml Triple Sec 15 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Garnish with sugar rim around the glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Martinez
Ingredients:
45 ml London Dry Gin
45 ml Sweet Red Vermouth
1 Bar Spoon Maraschino Liqueur
2 Dashes Orange Bitters
Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Monkey Gland
Ingredients:
45 ml Dry Gin
45 ml Fresh Orange Juice
1 Table Spoon Absinthe
1 Table Spoon Grenadine Syrup
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Old Cuban
Ingredients:
6/8 pcs Mint Leaves
45 ml Aged Rum
22.5 ml Fresh Lime Juice
30 ml Simple Syrup
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
60 ml Brut Champagne or Prosecco
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the wine, shake well with ice, strain into chilled elegant cocktail glass. Top up with the sparkling wine.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Penicillin
Ingredients:
60 ml Blended Scotch Whisky
7.5 ml Lagavulin 16y Whisky
22.5 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
22.5 ml Honey Syrup
2-3 quarter size Sliced Fresh Ginger
Making: Muddle fresh ginger in a shaker and add the remaining ingredients, except for the Islay single malt whiskey. Fill the shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled old fashioned glass with ice. Float the single malt whisky on top.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Ramos Fizz
Ingredients:
45 ml Gin
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
15 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
30 ml Sugar Syrup
60 ml Cream
30ml Egg white
3 Dashes Orange Flower Water
2 Drops Vanilla Extract
Soda Water
Making:
Pour all ingredients except soda water in a cocktail shaker with ice, Shake for two minutes, double strain in a glass, pour the drink back in the shaker, and hard shake without ice for one minute. Strain into a highball glass, top up with soda.
NOTE:
The drink was invented by Henry Ramos in 1888, at his bar Meyer’s Table d’Hôtel Internationale in New Orleans. The Ramos Fizz was originally shaken for 12 minutes by a crew of 30 bartenders who passed the shaker from one to another.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Sex on the Beach
Ingredients:
40 ml Vodka
20 ml Peach Schnapps
40 ml Fresh Orange Juice
40 ml Cranberry Juice
Making: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish: Garnish with a half orange slice.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Spritz
Ingredients:
90 ml Prosecco
60 ml Aperol
Splash of Soda water
Making:
Build all ingredients into a wine glass filled with ice. Stir gently.
NOTE:
There are other versions of the Spritz that use Campari, Cynar or Select instead of Aperol.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of orange.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Tommy’s Margarita
Ingredients:
60 ml Tequila Agave 100% Reposado
30 ml Fresh Lime Juice (Persiano)
30 ml Agave Syrup (1/2 Water + 1/2 Agave Nectar)
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Whiskey Sour

45 ml Bourbon Whiskey

Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into cobbler glass. If served “On the rocks”, strain ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice.
Garnish: Garnish with a half orange slice and maraschino cherry, optionally use orange zest.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Americano
Ingredients:
30 ml Bitter Campari

Making: Mix the ingredients directly in an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Add a splash of Soda Water. Stir gently.
Garnish: Garnish with half orange slice and a lemon zest.

Name: Bellini
Ingredients:
100 ml Prosecco
50 ml White Peach Puree
Making: Pour peach puree into the mixing glass with ice, add the Prosecco wine. Stir gently and pour in a chilled flute glass.

Name: Bramble
Ingredients:
50 ml Gin
25 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
12,5 ml Sugar Syrup
15 ml Crème de Mûre
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the Crème de Mûre, shake well with ice, strain into chilled old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice, then pour the blackberry liqueur (Crème de Mûre) over the top of the drink, in a circular motion.
Garnish: Garnish optionally with a lemon slice and blackberries.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Champagne Cocktail
Ingredients:
90 ml Chilled Champagne
10 ml Cognac
2 dashes Angostura bitters
Few drops of Grand Marnier (optional)
1 sugar cube
Making: Place the sugar cube with 2 dashes of bitters in a large Champagne glass, add the cognac. Pour gently chilled Champagne.
Garnish: Garnish with orange zest and maraschino cherry.

Name: Daiquiri
Ingredients:
60 ml White Cuban Ron
20 ml Fresh Lime Juice
2 Bar Spoons Superfine Sugar
Making: In a cocktail shaker add all ingredients. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: French 75
Ingredients:
30 ml Gin
15 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
15 ml Sugar Syrup
60 ml Champagne
Making: Pour all the ingredients, except Champagne, into a shaker. Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

Name: Grasshopper
Ingredients:
20 ml Crème de Cacao (White)
20 ml Crème de Menthe (Green)
20 ml Fresh Cream
Making:
Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice.
Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Irish Coffee
Ingredients:
50 ml Irish Whiskey
120 ml Hot coffee
50 ml Fresh cream (Chilled)
1 teaspoon Sugar
Making:
Warm black coffee is poured into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass. Whiskey and at least one teaspoon of sugar is added and stirred until dissolved. Fresh thick chilled cream is carefully poured over the back of a spoon held just above the surface of the coffee. The layer of cream will float on the coffee without mixing.
Plain sugar can be replaced with sugar syrup
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Long Island Ice Tea
Ingredients:
15 ml Vodka
15 ml Tequila
15 ml White rum
15 ml Gin
15 ml Cointreau
30 ml Lemon juice
20 ml Simple syrup
Top with Cola
Making:
Add all ingredients into a highball glass filled with ice.
Stir gently.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: IBA Cocktail

Name: Mary Pickford
Ingredients:
45 ml White Rum

Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Making: In a Mule Cup or rocks glass, combine the vodka and ginger beer. Add lime juice and gently stir to involve all ingredients.

Making: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitter, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently.
Garnish: Garnish with an orange slice or zest, and a cocktail cherry.

Making: Blend all the ingredients with ice in an electric blender, pour into a large glass, and serve with straws.

Top up Sparkling wine
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled tall tumbler glass filled with ice, and top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish: Garnish with blackberries and optionally a lemon slice as well.

Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

Making: Mix together all ingredients with ice cubes in a mixing glass and strain into prepared slim cocktail glass.
Garnish: Rub a slice of orange (or lemon) around the rim of the glass and dip it in pulverized white sugar, so that the sugar will adhere to the edge of the glass. Carefully curling place the orange/lemon peel around the inside of the glass.

* The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of “rummy” from molasses.

Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into Hurricane glass.

Notes:
*If desired water can be replaced by chamomile infusion in the honey mix.
Garnish: Garnish with lemon zest and white grapes.

Name: Yellow Bird

30 ml White rum

15 ml Triple Sec
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Black Russian

Name: Canchanchara

Making: Mix honey with water and lime juice and spread the mixture on the bottom and sides of the glass. Add cracked ice, and then the rum. End by energetically stirring from bottom to top.

Name: French Martini

45 ml Vodka

Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Hemingway Special

60 ml Rum

KIR ROYAL – Use Champagne instead of white wine

Name: Manhattan
Ingredients:
50 ml Rye Whiskey

Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

METHOD

Name: Ramos Fizz
Ingredients:
45 ml Gin
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
15 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
30 ml Sugar Syrup
60 ml Cream
30ml Egg white
3 Dashes Orange Flower Water
2 Drops Vanilla Extract
Soda Water
Making:
Pour all ingredients except soda water in a cocktail shaker with ice, Shake for two minutes, double strain in a glass, pour the drink back in the shaker, and hard shake without ice for one minute. Strain into a highball glass, top up with soda.
NOTE:
The drink was invented by Henry Ramos in 1888, at his bar Meyer’s Table d’Hôtel Internationale in New Orleans. The Ramos Fizz was originally shaken for 12 minutes by a crew of 30 bartenders who passed the shaker from one to another.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: The Unforgettables

Name: Irish Coffee
Ingredients:
50 ml Irish Whiskey
120 ml Hot coffee
50 ml Fresh cream (Chilled)
1 teaspoon Sugar
Making:
Warm black coffee is poured into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass. Whiskey and at least one teaspoon of sugar is added and stirred until dissolved. Fresh thick chilled cream is carefully poured over the back of a spoon held just above the surface of the coffee. The layer of cream will float on the coffee without mixing.
Plain sugar can be replaced with sugar syrup

22.5 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
22.5 ml Honey Syrup
2-3 quarter size Sliced Fresh Ginger
Making: Muddle fresh ginger in a shaker and add the remaining ingredients, except for the Islay single malt whiskey. Fill the shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled old fashioned glass with ice. Float the single malt whisky on top.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Suffering Bastard
Ingredients:
30 ml Cognac or Brandy
30 ml Gin
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
Top up Ginger beer
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the ginger beer, shake well with ice, Pour unstrained into a Collins glass or in the original S. Bastard mug and top up with ginger beer.
Garnish: Garnish with mint springs and optionally an orange slice as well.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Bee’s Knees
Ingredients:
52.5 ml Dry Gin
2 teaspoons Honey Syrup
22.5 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
22.5 ml Fresh Orange Juice
Making: Stir honey with lemon and orange juices until it dissolves, add gin and shake with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Optionally garnish with a lemon or orange zest.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Fernandito
Ingredients:
50 ml Fernet Branca
Fill up with Cola
Making: Pour the Fernet Branca into a double old fashioned glass with ice, fill the glass up with Cola. Gently stir.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: New York Sour
Ingredients:
60 ml Rye Whiskey or Bourbon
22.5 ml Simple syrup
30 ml Fresh lemon juice
Few Drops of Egg White
15 ml Red wine (Shiraz or Malbech)
Making: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice. Float the wine on top.
Garnish: Garnish with lemon or orange zest with cherry.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Russian Spring Punch
Ingredients:
25 ml Vodka
25 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
15 ml Crème de Cassis
10 ml Sugar syrup
Top up Sparkling wine
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled tall tumbler glass filled with ice, and top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish: Garnish with blackberries and optionally a lemon slice as well.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Tipperary
Ingredients:
50 ml Irish Whiskey
25 ml Sweet Red Vermouth
15 ml Green Chartreuse
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
Making: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of orange.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Bramble
Ingredients:
50 ml Gin
25 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
12,5 ml Sugar Syrup
15 ml Crème de Mûre
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker except the Crème de Mûre, shake well with ice, strain into chilled old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice, then pour the blackberry liqueur (Crème de Mûre) over the top of the drink, in a circular motion.
Garnish: Garnish optionally with a lemon slice and blackberries.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: French Martini
Ingredients:
45 ml Vodka
15 ml Raspberry Liqueur
15 ml Fresh Pineapple Juice
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Old Cuban
Ingredients:
6/8 pcs Mint Leaves
45 ml Aged Rum
22.5 ml Fresh Lime Juice
30 ml Simple Syrup
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
60 ml Brut Champagne or Prosecco
Making: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the wine, shake well with ice, strain into chilled elegant cocktail glass. Top up with the sparkling wine.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Southside
Ingredients:
60 ml London Dry Gin
30 ml Fresh Lemon Juice
15 ml Simple Syrup
5/6 Mint Leaves
Few Drops of Egg White (Optional)
Making:
Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Note:
If egg white is used shake vigorously.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Tommy’s Margarita
Ingredients:
60 ml Tequila Agave 100% Reposado
30 ml Fresh Lime Juice (Persiano)
30 ml Agave Syrup (1/2 Water + 1/2 Agave Nectar)
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Canchanchara
Ingredients:
60 ml Cuban Aguardiente
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
15 ml Raw Honey
50 ml Water
Making: Mix honey with water and lime juice and spread the mixture on the bottom and sides of the glass. Add cracked ice, and then the rum. End by energetically stirring from bottom to top.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Illegal
Ingredients:
30 ml Espadin Mezcal
15 ml Jamaica Overproof White Rum
15 ml Falernum
1 Bar Spoon Maraschino Luxardo
22.5 ml Fresh Lime Juice
15 ml Simple Syrup
Few Drops of Egg White (Optional)
Making: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, or “on the rocks” in a traditional clay or terracotta mug.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Paloma
Ingredients:
50 ml 100% Agave Tequila
5 ml Fresh lime
A pinch of Salt
100 ml Pink Grapefruit Soda
Making: Poor the tequila into a highball glass, squeeze the lime juice. Add ice and salt, fill up pink grapefruit soda. Stir gently.
Garnish: Garnish with a slice of lime.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: Spicy Fifty
Ingredients:
50 ml Vodka Vanilla
15 ml Elderflower Cordial
15 ml Fresh Lime Juice
10 ml Monin Honey Syrup
2 thin Slices Red Chili Pepper
Making: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish: Garnish with a red chili pepper
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks

Name: VE.N.TO
Ingredients:
45 ml White Smooth Grappa
22.5 ml Fresh lemon Juice
15 ml Honey mix (replace water with chamomile)*
15 ml Chamomile cordial
10ml Egg White (Optional)
Making:
Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled small tumbler glass filled with ice.
Notes:
*If desired water can be replaced by chamomile infusion in the honey mix.
Garnish: Garnish with lemon zest and white grapes.
Type: IBA Official Cocktail list: New Era Drinks
